messages:
"%1" is not a recognized transformation type. The supported transformation types are .
An input file is not specified, or it is specified using the wrong parameter.
The input file '%1' cannot be located or read. Ensure that file was specified properly and that you have permission to access it.
Cannot find the user-specified XSLT stylesheet '%1'.
Invalid DITA-topic extension '%1'. The supported values are '.dita' and '.xml'.
The Ant parameters 'dita.input' and 'dita.input.dirname' are deprecated. Use the parameter 'args.input'.
Absolute paths on the local file system are not supported for the CSSPATH parameter. Use a relative path or full URI.
Cannot find the running-footer file "%1". Double check the value and ensure that it is specified correctly.
Cannot find the running-header file "%1". Double check the value and ensure that it is specified correctly.
Cannot find the heading file "%1". Double check the value and ensure that it is specified correctly.
The Apache FOP program cannot be found in the default location. Place FOP into the default directory demo/fo/fop/ or update the build file to support your local configuration.
The argument "%1" is deprecated. This argument is no longer supported.
The argument "%1" is deprecated. Use the argument "%2".
Invalid command-line syntax for the parameter '%1'. Parameters for the command-line tool must use the syntax /parameter:value.
Unsupported parameter '%1'. See the DITA-OT User Guide for information about supported parameters.
The parameter '%1' was specified without a value. Parameters for the command-line tool must use the syntax /parameter:value.
Cannot create temporary processing directory '%1'. Ensure that you have permission to create the directory '%1'.
>
Failed to create new instance for '%1'. Ensure that '%1' exists and that you have permission to access it.
An Ant build file used the following illegal syntax when calling AntInvoker: extparam='%1'. Correct the call to AntInvoker when directly calling DITA-OT Java code from Ant, for example, extparam="maplinks=XXXX;other=YYYY".
Duplicate condition in the filter file for rule '%1'. The first encountered condition will be used.
Cannot overwrite file '%1' with file '%2'. The modified result might not be consumed by the following steps in the transform pipeline. Determine whether the file is locked by another application during the transformation process.
Failed to parse the input file '%1'. The XML parser reported an error.
Failed to parse the referenced file '%1'. The XML parser reported an error.
Found an indexterm element with no content. Setting the content to ***.
The log directory cannot be null. Specify a valid directory for the build log.
Failed to create log directory '%1'. Specify a valid directory for the build log.
No input file was specified; failed to initialize log name based on input file.
The log file '%1' was generated successfully in directory '%2'. Messages from the transformation process are available in the log file; additional details about each message are available in the DITA-OT user guide.
At least one plug-in in '%1' is required by plug-in '%2'. Plug-in '%2' cannot be loaded. Determine whether all prerequisite plug-ins are installed.
File '%1' will not generate output. The file is invalid or all of its content has been filtered out by a .ditaval file. Examine the file '%1' and the .ditaval file to determin whether this is the intended result.
Failed to parse the input file '%1' because all of its content has been filtered out. Determine whether the input file has filtering conditions set on the root element, and if the .ditaval file has specified that the content should be excluded.
Failed to get the specified image file '%1'; it will not be included in the output.
The input to the "topic merge" process was not found. Correct any earlier transformation errors and run the build again. See the DITA-OT User Guide for additional information.
The "topic merge" process did not generate any output. Correct any earlier transformation errors and run the build again. See the DITA-OT User Guide for additional information.
The reference to file '%1' does not include a value for the @format attribute, and the file is not a DITA file. Set the @format attribute to an appropriate value.
The element '<%1>' does not have a value for the @domains attribute. Your DTD or Schema does not conform to the DITA specification.
The element '<%1>' does not have a value for the @class attribute.. Your DTD or Schema does not conforma to the DITA specification.
The .ditaval file does not contain a rule for '%1'. The default action or a parent prop action will be used. Specify a rule for '%1' in the .ditaval file.
During chunk processing, no valid content was found in topicref '%1'. Ensure that the topicref element references an existing and valid topic.
Failed to parse the input file '%1'; the content of the file is not valid. If '%1' does not have a DOCTYPE declaration, ensure that all class attributes are present in the file.
The file "%1" referenced by "%2" is outside the scope of the directory that contains the input file. To lower the severity level, use the Ant parameter 'outer.control', and set the value to "warn" or "quiet". Otherwise, move "%1" into the input directory.
The file "%1" referenced by "%2" is outside the scope of the directory that contains the input file. To lower the severity level, use the Ant parameter 'outer.control', and set the value to "warn" or "quiet". Otherwise, move "%1" into the input directory.
The XML schema and DTD validation function of the parser is turned off. Ensure the input is normalized DITA that includes class attributes; otherwise the input will not be processed correctly.
The element "%1" is specialized from unrecognized metadata. Ensure that the element "%1" is specialized from an existing metadata element in the core DITA vocabulary.
No target specified for conref push action "pushafter". Found in file="%1", element="%2". Add <elementname conref="pushtarget" conaction="mark"> before current element.
An element uses the attribute conaction="replace", but a conref attribute is not found in the expected location. Found in file="%1", element="%2".
The attribute conref="%1" uses invalid syntax. The value should contain '#' followed by a topic or map ID, optionally followed by '/elemID' for a sub-topic element.
Two elements both use conref push to replace the target "%1". Please delete one of the duplicate "replace" actions.
The conref push function is trying to replace an element that does not exist (element "%1" in file "%2").
There is a redundant conref action "pushbefore". Found in file="%1", element="%2". Please make sure that "mark" and "pushbefore" occur in pairs.
The key "%1" is defined more than once. The reference href="%2" is ignored.
Conkeyref="%1" can not be resolved because it does not contain a key or the key is not defined. The build will use the conref attribute for fallback, if one exists.
Unable to find a key definition for keyref="%1".href may be used as fallback if it exists. The build will use the href attribute for fallback, if one exists.
The attribute value %1="%3" on element "%2" does not comply with the specified subject scheme. The following values are valid for the %1 attribute: %4
Found an <index-see> or <index-see-also> element that referenced the index entry '%1', but that term is not defined in the index.
Unable to load target for coderef "%1". Found in file="%2", element="%3".
The charset "%1" not supported. See the DITA-OT User guide for supported charset values for the @format attribute.
The input file '%1' is not a valid DITA file name. Check '%1' to see if it is correct. Only the extensions ".dita" or ".xml" are supported for DITA topics.
No string named '%1' was found for language '%2'. Using the default language '%3'. Add a mapping between default language and desired language for the string '%1'.
For Eclipse output, the DITA map must contain a title element or attribute.
The anchorref attribute should reference a DITA map or an Eclipse TOC file. The value '%1' does not reference either.
Found a navref element that does not reference anything. The navref element should reference a DITA map or an Eclipse XML file.
Unable to find navigation title for a reference to '%1'. The build will use '%1' as the title in the Eclipse TOC.
Unknown file extension in href="%1". Set the @format attribute to match the resource, for example, 'txt', 'pdf', or 'html'.
Only DITA topics, HTML files, and images can be included in your compiled CHM file. The reference to "%1" will be ignored. Modify the topicref element; set the @toc attribute to 'no' or the @processing-role attribute to 'resource-only'.
File '%1' cannot be loaded, and no navigation title is specified for the TOC.
File '%1' does not exist or cannot be loaded.
Could not retrieve a title from '%1'. Using '%2' instead.
Unable to find target for conref="%1".
There is more than one possible target for the reference conref="%1". The first encountered instance will be used. Remove the duplicate value for the @id attribute.
When you conref another topic or an item in another topic, the domains attribute of the target topic must be equal to or a subset of the current topic's domains attribute. Put your target under an appropriate domain. You can see the messages guide for more help.
A element with attribute conref="%1" indirectly includes itself, which results in an infinite loop.
The attribute conref="%1" uses invalid syntax. Conref references to a map element should contain '#' followed by an ID, for example, mymap.ditamap#mytopicrefid.
The attribute conref="%1" uses invalid syntax. The value must contain '#' followed by a topic or map ID, optionally followed by '/elemID' for a sub-topic element.
A reference to "%2" appears to reference a DITA document, but the format attribute has inherited a value of "%1". %2 will not be processed as a DITA file.
Found a link or cross reference with an empty href attribute (href=""). Remove the empty href attribute or specify a value.
The @type attribute on a topicref was set to '%1', but the topicref references a more specific '%2' topic. The @type attribute cascades in maps, so the value '%1' might be set on a containing topicref.
The @type attribute on a topicref was set to '%1', but the topicref references a '%2' topic. This might cause your links to be sorted incorrectly in the output. The @type attribute cascades in maps, so the value '%1' might be set on a containing topicref.
Missing a navtitle attribute or element for the peer topic "%1". References must provide a local navigation title when the target is not a local DITA resource.
Missing a navtitle attribute or element for the peer topic "%1". References must provide a local navigation title when the target is not a local DITA resource.
Unable to retrieve navtitle from the target: '%1'. Using linktext specified in topicmeta as the navigation title.
Unable to retrieve navtitle from the target: '%1'.
Missing linktext and navtitle for the peer topic "%1". References must provide a local navigation title when the target is not a local DITA resource.
Missing linktext and navtitle for a non-DITA resource "%1". References must provide a local navigation title when the target is not a local DITA resource.
Unable to retrieve linktext from target: '%1'. Using navigation title as a fallback.
Unable to retrieve linktext from target: '%1'.
Link or cross reference must contain a valid href or keyref attribute; no link target is specified.
The @type attribute on a %1 element was set to %3, but the reference is to a more specific %4 %2. This might cause your links to be sorted incorrectly in the output.
The type attribute on a %1 element was set to %3, but the reference is to a %4 %2. This might cause your links to to be sorted incorrectly in the output.
The file %1 is not available to resolve link information.
Unable to retrieve link text from target: '%1'. If the target is not accessible at build time or does not have a title, provide the link text inside of the reference.
Unable to generate link text for a cross reference to a list item: '%1'
Unable to generate link text for a cross reference to an unordered list item: '%1'
Unable to generate the correct number for a cross reference to a footnote: '%1'
Unable to generate link text for a cross reference to the dlentry '%1'; the dlentry or term could not be found.
No title found for this document; using "***" in XHTML title bar.
The longdescref attribute on tag '%1' will be ignored. Accessibility for object elements needs to be handled in another way.
Required cleanup area found. To remove this message and hide the content, build your content without using the DRAFT parameter.
Draft comment area found. To remove this message and hide the comments, build your content without using the DRAFT parameter.
Found more than one title element in a section. Using the first one for the section title.
DITAVAL based flagging is not currently supported for inline phrases in XHTML; ignoring flag value on '%1' attribute.
The link to '%1' might appear more than once in '%2'.
The area element in an image map does not specify a link target. Add an xref element with a link target to the area element.
The area element in an image map should specify link text for greater accessibility. Specify link text when the target is not a local DITA resource.
Area shape should be 'default', 'rect', 'circle', 'poly', blank (no value). The value '%1' is not recognized.
Area coordinates are blank. Specify coordinate points for the shape.
To include the peer or external topic '%1' in your help file, you might need to recompile the CHM file after making the file available.
References to non-DITA files are ignored by the ODT, PDF, and RTF transformations.
The default id "org.sample.help.doc" is used for Eclipse plug-in. To use your own plug-in ID, specify it using the @id attribute on the map.
No string named '%1' was found when creating generated text; using the value '%1' in your output file.
A element that references another map indirectly includes itself, which results in an infinite loop. The original map reference is to '%1'.
Conflict text style is applied on the current element based on DITAVAL flagging rules. Please check ditaval and dita source to make sure there is no style conflict on the element which needs to be flagged.
A customized stylesheet uses the deprecated template 'flagit'. Conditional processing using this template is no longer supported. Update your stylesheet to use the template 'start-flagit'.
The file '%1' is not available to resolve link information.
The link or cross reference target '%1' cannot be found. This might cause link or cross reference errors in the output.
No glossary entry was found associated with key '%1' on %2 element. The build will try to determine the best display and hover text for terms and abbreviations.
The key '%1' was used in an abbreviated-form element, but the key is not associated with a glossary entry. Use abbreviated-form elements only to reference a glossary entry.
The id '%1' was used in topicref element, but it did not reference a topic element. The @href attribute on a topicref element should only reference topic-level elements.
This document uses constraints, but the conref processor cannot validate that the target of a conref is valid. To enable constraint checking, upgrade to an XSLT 2.0 processor.
Your content links to DITA file '%1', but '%1' is not referenced by a topicref element in the DITA map. To avoid a broken link, include the topic in your DITA map.
The value of the @copy-to attribute '%1' is the name of an already-existing file; the attribute is ignored.
Two unique source files each specify copy-to="%2", which results in a collision. The value associated with href="%1" is ignored.
Template "%1" is deprecated. Remove references to this template from your custom stylesheets or plug-ins.
No string named '%1' was found for language '%2'. Add a mapping for the string '%1'.
Cannot find the user specified stylesheet '%1'.
Ignoring index-see '%1' inside parent index entry '%2' because the parent indexterm element contains indexterm children. The index-see element should be ignored if the parent indexterm contains other indexterm children.
Ignoring index-see-also '%1' inside parent index entry '%2' because the parent indexterm element contains indexterm children. The index-see-also element should be ignored if the parent indexterm contains other indexterm children.
Target "%1" is deprecated. Remove references to this target from your custom stylesheets or plug-ins.
